title: How to Make Chaskaydar Mirchi Dahi Bhalay

steps.headline: Soak the lentils in water.
steps.description: You have to do this for 6 hours, so start early.

steps.headline: Place the soaked lentils in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the ginger, crushed red pepper to taste and 1/2 teaspoon or so of salt.

steps.headline: Add baking soda and mix in thoroughly.
steps.description: Only add this just before you're about the fry the daal. Roll into small balls to get it ready for frying.

steps.headline: Heat the oil in the frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Wait until it's very hot. Add the balls and fry. Fry until they turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Remove the balls from the oil.
steps.description: Soak in warm water for 30 minutes. Press them flat when they are finished soaking.

steps.headline: Pour the yogurt into a mixing bowl.
Add ground black pepper.
steps.description: Add enough to make it spicy, to taste.

steps.headline: Mix together to combine.
steps.description: Set aside for use when serving. If not using immediately, keep refrigerated.

steps.headline: Arrange the items onto a large serving platter.
Place the mixed daal bhalay first.
Pour the spicy yogurt over the top of the dish.
Drizzle the imli sauce over the top of the spicy yogurt.
Sprinkle with red chilli flakes, fresh coriander leaves and chaat masala.
Add a little extra finely diced onion, if you wish.
steps.description: Finally, place a little tub of chutney alongside the dish, to be eaten as desired by each diner.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Allow diners to help themselves to portions with a serving spoon or similar utensil. Serve with chuksa, a form of plaited bread baked with cheese.

text: Prepare the dahi\/daal bhalay Soak the lentils in water. You have to do this for 6 hours, so start early. Place the soaked lentils in a mixing bowl. Add the ginger, crushed red pepper to taste and 1/2 teaspoon or so of salt. Add baking soda and mix in thoroughly. Only add this just before you're about the fry the daal. Roll into small balls to get it ready for frying. Heat the oil in the frying pan or skillet. Wait until it's very hot. Add the balls and fry. Fry until they turn golden brown. Remove the balls from the oil. Soak in warm water for 30 minutes. Press them flat when they are finished soaking. Prepare the spicy yogurt Pour the yogurt into a mixing bowl.  Add ground black pepper. Add enough to make it spicy, to taste. Add the diced onion.  Mix together to combine. Set aside for use when serving. If not using immediately, keep refrigerated. Put the dish together Arrange the items onto a large serving platter.  Place the mixed daal bhalay first.  Pour the spicy yogurt over the top of the dish.  Drizzle the imli sauce over the top of the spicy yogurt.  Sprinkle with red chilli flakes, fresh coriander leaves and chaat masala.  Add a little extra finely diced onion, if you wish. Finally, place a little tub of chutney alongside the dish, to be eaten as desired by each diner. Serve. Allow diners to help themselves to portions with a serving spoon or similar utensil. Serve with chuksa, a form of plaited bread baked with cheese.
